Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the worlds best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Job Summary This job code is to be used for internships and co-ops. It is not to be used for temporary or contract workers. Job Description Overview As a software engineer intern you will have the opportunity to assist full time technical members of the Traffic Control team during the 11-week program. Traffic Control is an integral part of our Content Delivery Network (CDN) that localizes clients and routes them to the best cache for them. You will get a front row seat to the day-to-day operations of a cutting-edge media and technology company. Youll work on creative, innovative, and thought-provoking development projects that drive quality into the Apache Traffic Control open-source project. The Traffic Control team is primarily responsible for feature development, bug fixes, and the reduction of tech debt across all components of Traffic Control to ensure the quality and reliability of the control plane of the CDN. Who does the Software Engineer Intern work with? The software engineer intern works alongside the development and site reliability engineers (SRE) focusing on the design, engineering, development, validation, implementation and operation of the CDN supporting the core applications of the CDN. These teams are comprised of some of the most experienced and talented software engineers, project managers, scrum masters, and network engineers youll ever have the pleasure to work with, and youll play a key role. What are some interesting problems youll be working on? Comcast delivers an enormous amount of content--over 15 years of contiguous On-Demand content, and thousands of always-on linear channels, to millions of users every day. There are many challenges involved in delivering content at scale while matching the availability expectations of historical cable customers. We are driving the bleeding edge in IP video delivery, and you'll be working on products that millions of users count on every day. Where can you make an impact? With code! This is a development role, with a wide variety of opportunities across the entire spectrum of platforms that we serve: we need the best and brightest developers to help us build the next generation of cutting edge video delivery technologies. What background do you have? * Passion for programming and software test automation * Experience using source control systems such as GitHub * Experience with defect tracking, monitoring, and reporting * Experience testing applications and systems * Experience working with build management and continuous integration tools like Jenkins Whats your style? * Good communicator with the ability to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies * Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution * Comfortable working in a fast-paced agile environment requirements change quickly, and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets * Proactively troubleshoot and find solutions to production issues Specific Technologies used at VIPER (in no particular order, and not necessarily limited to): * Programming Language: Go / Java / Python / Bash * Source Control: Git / Github * CI/CD Tooling: Jenkins * Containers: Docker * Work Tracking: JIRA Desirable Skills & Experience: * Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment * Knowledge of adaptive bitrate video, including HLS (HTTP live streaming) and MPEG-DASH (Dynamic adaptive streaming over HTTP) * IP TV Streaming knowledge Core Responsibilities * Regular, Consistent and punctual attendance. * Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Compensation Base Pay: $32.00 Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. Thats why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details. Education Certifications (if applicable) Relative Work Experience 0-2 Years Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the worlds best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Job Summary As an intern on the Reliability Analytics and Data Science (RADS) team, youll be a part of turning massive datasets into actionable insights that improve the services we offer our customers. The Reliability Analytics and Data Science team is a multifunctional, fast paced team, that is bringing novel approaches and tools to complex problems. Youll get to explore over 30PB of data, stored in a variety of formats and while learning SQL and Spark! Along the way, youll collaborate with data scientists, data engineers and software developers in order to deliver the best data driven answers that our customers deserve! In this role, youll get a chance to learn a broad set of data science, analytics and to some degree data engineering skills. Success on our team is characterized by improving the customer experience through higher reliability and service quality and through the data-driven decision making we empower! Job Description Responsibilities: * Help discover and explore data in a variety of formats to find the best answers * Write SQL and Spark code to arrive at insights * Deliver actionable summaries of your findings through presentations and dashboards * Balance independent and collaborative work as a part of a multi-functional agile team Skills & Requirements * Some familiarity with one of the following: SQL, Spark, Pandas, Tableau, Python, R, Databricks or similar * Ability to communicate effectively * Curious and inquisitive mindset looking for opportunities to learn, improve and optimize * Experience working in the cloud is a big plus Compensation Base Pay: $32.00 Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. Thats why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details. Education Certifications (if applicable) Relative Work Experience 0-2 Years Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.

About Clearwater Analytics� Clearwater Analytics� is a global SaaS solution for automated investment data aggregation, reconciliation, accounting, and reporting. Clearwater helps thousands of organizations make the most of investment portfolio data with cloud-native software and client-centric servicing. Every day, investment professionals worldwide trust Clearwater to deliver timely, validated investment data and in-depth reporting. Clearwater aggregates, reconciles, and reports on more than $3 trillion in assets across thousands of accounts daily for our Fortune 500 clients. DESCRIPTION Our Summer internship experience is unique to Clearwater. We'll give you two experienced lead developers who will be your mentors, guides and teachers throughout the summer, as well as access to all our full-time development teams. We treat our interns just like our full-time employees. Within the first week you'll learn and put into practice the methods we use every day to work together effectively to create and build a world-class awesome financial software. Before the end of the summer, you'll have created something with your team to be really proud of. All of that and we pay you a top-notch competitive wage for your field! Responsibilities Strong problem-solving skills Working towards Computer Science or related degree Motivated, team player Someone who isn't afraid to say I don't know, let's figure it out! REQUIREMENTS Current students pursuing a four-year degree in Computer Science, Math, or related What you'll get from us: Opportunity to work for the fastest growing technology firm in Idaho Exposure to new technologies, skills and software tools (Agile development, Java, SQL, front end, back end, everything in between) Opportunity to work on real projects and write code that will be used by our clients and contribute to the company's bottom line The chance to work with CS students from all over the country Pair programming Trainings presented by experienced, full-time developers Great work culture with a driven, low key, work and life balanced environment Flexible work hours (it's the summer, after all. We work hard but we have fun too) Freedom to be creative Intern summer events Competitive wages

position: Intern - Data Science Project Analyst - Summer 2022 - CO or Remote/Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Science Project Analyst intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Team to model and build frameworks and develop business applications and provide insights. Tasks during the 10 weeks may include: Define project/program objectives and milestones, track work progress, coordinate and solicit inputs from field leaders, document outcomes, perform data science tasks such as identifying and sourcing data, do database processing, perform analytical or statistical modeling, simulate outcomes, communicate findings and provide business insights. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Potential projects may include: •    Help with creating a capital efficiency model to determine and reduce cost per enabled household  •    Look at investments to ensure Lumen is spending correctly •    Ensure capital and operational efficiency  •    Provide insights on opportunities for scaling, bring problem solving designs to leadership board   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science, MIS, Accounting, Finance, or a related field. -    Proficiency and understanding of: -    Microsoft Suites  -    SQL experience is a must -    Python is a plus -    R background is a plus -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    Comfortable calling and asking for information  -    Desire to be mentored, molded, and work in a team environment  -    Ability to communicate extremely well is necessary -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Capable of relaying output in a professional manner to internal and external leadership teams  -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Littleton, CO or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Requisition #: 263984 EEO STATEMENT We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, “protected statuses”).  We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. DISCLAIMER The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

Hi everyone. First and foremost, we want to stress that this internship provides a great learning experience to all our interns in a highly positive environment. In fact, last summer our internships were ranked #6 in the nation.

SocialTech Labs brings together passionate, creative, young individuals across the globe to help build our upcoming social media app: BestFriends, a closed social networking app promoting positivity in a magically safe place (especially helpful on difficult days) with your 5 best friends. Interns would work with other interns and teen team leaders (https://socialtechlabs.com/team/).

We are a virtual company using Skype as our primary method of day-to-day communication. In addition, we have weekly Zoom calls.

**The DT Intern Scholars Program is designed for undergraduate sophomores who self-identify as Black/African American and or Hispanic/Latinx.** The program is a multi-year experience exposing students to different roles within the tech industry. It will provide participants with knowledge and training to strengthen technical and communication skills while building business acumen and providing visibility to career opportunities. As a DT Intern Scholar, you will have two internship opportunities to work in a high-performing team and provide solutions to our customers’ most complex issues. Each summer, you will be assigned an innovative project where you can quickly ramp and make real contributions. Whether delivering tools / features, testing a new product, enhancing inventory management controls or working with teams that support our customers daily, you will learn what it’s like to work in a fast-pasted organization that provides leading edge solutions to customer challenges. You’ll have opportunities to interact with leaders, other summer interns and network at professional development and social events. At the end of your tenure you’ll share what you’ve accomplished. Upon successful completion of the first DT Intern Scholars internship, students may receive a second DT Scholars internship offer. Those who successfully complete all DT Scholars internships and maintain high academic achievement may receive full-time job offers. **Program Internship Offerings** DT Intern Scholars internship roles are available across several of Dell’s business units within the Products and Operations organization. We offer internships in 5 areas and details can be found below. **1. Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG): Engineering Intern **(Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA; Santa Clara, CA; Seattle, WA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: The Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) at Dell Technologies delivers the essential infrastructure for organizations to build their digital future, transform IT from core to cloud to edge and protect their most important asset: information! As an ISG Engineering Intern, you will focus on the future needs of our business and our customers through a communities of practice internship model. You and your intern team will drive an end to end project connected towards one of our community themes, with support from a project lead, community members and subject matter experts in the business. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Technology related degree | Understanding of Computer Science/Computer Engineering Foundations **2. Client Solutions Group: Engineering Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX; Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Deliver the essential commercial, consumer, gaming and software solutions to individuals and organization across the globe and offer great opportunities to deliver innovation across cloud services, security, hardware, and software solutions. As a Software Engineering Intern, you will innovate, design, implement and debug modules and infrastructure created for our next generation product offering. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in the following Majors- ME, Thermal, CE, EE, IT, MIS, CS, Computing or similar fields. | for Software positions you will need proficiency in at least one of C/C++/Java/JavaScript/ Python/Node.js | Hands-on implementation experience in data structures, algorithms, and OS | Working knowledge of Linux systems, distributed systems, and cloud-related environments | For Hardware you will need proficiency in any of the design software: Creo, Fusion, ANSYS, and/or Flotherm XT/Flotherm computational fluid dynamics simulation software. (Equivalent tool experience is acceptable) **3. Client Solutions Group: Marketing Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Gain real Marketing business experience and get project-based roles throughout North America Marketing Operations (COC) organization. Develop project plans/schedules, define project requirements, manage communications, and report on project status. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree with concentration in Marketing, Business Administration, Business Management, Economics, Business Analytics, Finance or other related discipline. **4. Client Solutions Group: Sales Intern** (Internship locations: Round Rock, TX, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Support a key business initiative for our inside sales team and work with Inside Sales Managers and Director on a special project that will impact the organization. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Business Management, or other related discipline | Strong Organizational, analytical, problem solving, negotiation, and planning skills | Experience with Excel, PowerPoint is a plus. **5. Global Operations/Supply Chain Intern** (Internship locations: Austin, TX or Hopkinton, MA, Remote) ++What You’ll Do++: Join a world-class Global Operations supply chain where you can drive lasting change while building a long-term career. Interns work in different areas (e.g., procurement, manufacturing & operations, logistics) of Global Operations and all interns are expected to complete analysis and present results / recommendations to management on summer projects. ++Who You Are++: Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Industrial and Systems Engineering or applicable field.

position: Intern - Data Scientist - Summer 2022- CO or Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Scientist in our North America Operations organization, the Intern will work to develop and program methods, automated processes, and systems to cleanse, integrate and analyze structured and unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions using machine learning and advanced analytics. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include researching and crunching data to assist with system automation. The ideal intern will have technical skills with common languages in the industry.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment. -    Interprets and communicates insights and findings from analyses and experiments to other analysts, data scientists, team members and business partners.  -    Design working models and implement them on Big Data systems using Map Reduce or Spark frameworks. -    Assist with operationalizing the solutions and changing business processes to maximize the value of those solutions.  -    Identify patterns and leverage information discovered to create a more automated environment  WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE - EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine learning, Advanced Analytics, or similar technical degree field. -    PROFICIENCY AND UNDERSTANDING OF: -    Able to apply techniques such as classification, clustering, regression, deep learning, association, anomaly detection, time series forecasting, Hidden Markov models and Bayesian inference to solve pragmatic business problems -    Basic Experience with big data systems and basic programming languages -    Familiar with Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Scope, Cosmos, or similar technologies. -    Experience with statistical programming environments like Python, R, SPSS or IBM Watson Studio  -    Fluent in one or more object oriented-languages like C#, C++, Scala, Java, and scripting languages like Python or Ruby   -    Experience with PowerBI and sparking graphs -    PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES  -    Strong self-drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to show and present on data -    Comfort in speaking to those in leadership roles -    Strong ability to analyze -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation -    Self driven-works with minimal supervision -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    WORK SETTING -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, Littleton-CO,  or may consider remote/ work from home. -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours per week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. Job Description: The software development intern will work directly with our professional app developers and assist with a wide variety of projects as it relates to the TurnUp mobile and web app. The intern will report directly to members of our app development team.

TurnUp is looking for a few software engineering volunteers to contribute to our mobile and web app and help on a few other initiatives.

Interns will learn about progressive organizing, start-ups, partnerships, marketing, and about the non-profit, civic technology and progressive space.

If you possess any of the requirements below, we are very excited to hear from you, but it is not required that you possess one of these: * 1+ years of software development experience in a javascript heavy environment * 1+ years of experience with react-native, react-bootstrap, or react * 1+ years of experience in developing firebase functions in javascript or typescript * 1+ Experience in software architecture, planning and management * 1+ years of test engineering experience with of the following: mocha, jest, or similar * 1+ years of experience in developing RESTful APIs (preferably in javascript)

Here is some information about TurnUp:

At TurnUp (www.turnup.us), we are a collaborative workspace that believes in the power that young people can have when they are civically engaged. We believe that everyone should be able to access their activist potential, and that communication creates power. We hope to make the world just, fair and equitable for all, by engaging young people in our democracy.

This is an unpaid internship.

Interns will have the opportunity to work remotely and interact with the nonprofit technology community. Interns will have access to our illustrious advisory board, and make a real impact on youth voter turnout to further progressive change. Time commitment is negotiable.

Marine Science & Education Virtual/Remote Internship

Our team focuses on ecological restoration, community engagement, and research that ultimately protects our waterways and coastal environments. Historically, we have run field trips and volunteer days in the Gloucester area and performed a series of field projects including plastic and invasive mitigation, sea level rise data collection, and others.  In the face of the COVID-19 pandemic, we have implemented more virtual programming to involve our community in a meaningful and safe way. The ideal MS&E intern should be passionate about sustainability and knowledgeable about current issues related to our environment.

MS&E initiatives include: creating educational materials to facilitate citizen science, assisting in research for the Chebacco Lake restoration work, mitigating marine debris via various initiatives, collaborating with other Seaside teams, and more!

Desired skills: 

Outstanding writing and communication skills
Ability to work in a collaborative and interpersonal environment 
Must be able to perform literature reviews and extensive research into a wide range of topics
Should be able to organize and write about advanced scientific information for the general public 
Knowledge of how and when to cite sources (APA preferred)

Desired experience include: 

Research (preferably in STEM) 
Performance of scientific literature reviews and interaction with academic publications
Courses in environmental science, sustainability, or environmental justice 
Jobs in sustainability
Experience creating educational materials for children
ArcGIS experience is a bonus!

position: Intern - Software Applications Associate - Summer 2022 - CO or Remote/Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves. THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Software Applications Associate intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to assess the validity of internal needs and the network's ability to fulfill the demand and provide guidance on where & how the demand can be fulfilled. This position will have high exposure to network planning and capacity management. Tasks during the 10 weeks will provide a bridge between our sales team and what our network can provide to customers. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include: -    Build software tools to link API's between disparate internal systems to minimize the manual steps in the capacity management process- The software tools are intended to be working prototypes to support the business needs until an internal development team can take on a permanent, supported solution. -    Facilitate capacity check requests initiated from MySupportDesk and linked to Jira (to initiate an internal workflow) and an internal capacity check tool (to estimate traffic impacts).  -   Streamline the capacity check processes through the Compute Planning organization (accelerating large sales) and automate workload tracking in Planning  -    Continued support of Lumen's cutting edge Edge Compute (Bare Metal & Virtual Machine) and CDN services with other software development prototypes, as identified. WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Computer Science, MIS, Data Science, or related field  -    Proficiency and understanding of:  -    Microsoft Suites  -    Python -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    High attention to detail with STRONG organizational skills -    Enjoys working with a variety of different people -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Comfortability in unstructured environment  -    Flexible and able to adjust to changes -    Self-starter mindset -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield, CO, or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, TIBCO Software enables businesses to reach new heights on their path to digital distinction and innovation. From systems to devices and people, we interconnect everything, capture data in real time wherever it is, and augment the intelligence of organizations through analytical insights. Thousands of customers around the globe rely on us to build compelling experiences, energize operations, and propel innovation.   Our teams flourish on new ideas and welcome individuals who thrive in transforming challenges into opportunities. From designing and building amazing products to providing excellent service; we encourage and are shaped by bold thinkers, problem-solvers, and self-starters.  We are always adapting and providing exciting opportunities for our employees to grow, learn and excel. We value the customers and employees that define who we are; dynamic individuals willing to take the risks necessary to make big ideas come to life and who are comfortable collaborating in our creative, optimistic environment. TIBCO – we are just scratching the surface. ### **Overview** The TIBCO Information Security Team works with teams from across TIBCO, including engineering, cloud operations, IT, legal and sales, to ensure continuous improvement in our security posture. The Security Team’s efforts directly affect both TIBCO corporate and our customers. The team has a diverse set of responsibilities to ensure that risks that affect TIBCO customers as well as TIBCO itself are identified and remediated. This opportunity is for a self-starting individual to join a professional corporate information security team and participate in all areas of information security including risk assessment, requirements analysis, secure design principles, secure software development and validation, and communications. ### **What You'll Do** ●      Assess internal security processes, recommend changes or enhancements for identified security gaps, and implement recommendations ●      Align security standards, frameworks and policies with overall business and technology strategy ●      Work across the company to identify and implement privacy requirements ●      Collaborate with developers and other internal groups to identify, prioritize and develop improvements to secure software development tooling and practices, including our application security automation tooling ●      Work together with cross functional teams of Software Developers, Systems and Network Administrators, and others to improve the security of TIBCO product offerings ●      Make improvements to the open-source vulnerability management software built in Python/Django that we use to aggregate and report on our security findings **What You Will Learn** ●      Information security requirements that affect a multinational software development organization ●      The identification, analysis and prioritization of risks that affect enterprise software development and their associated remediations ●      Industry standards and regulations that affect enterprise information security ●      The tools and technologies that corporate security teams like ours use to manage the complexity of a fast-moving security environment ### **Who You Are** - Pursuing a bachelors or masters degree in Information Security, Computer Science or similar field - Pride yourself on being an excellent communicator - Enthusiastic and driven to learn new concepts and participate as part of a cooperative and professional information security team - Classroom experience or better in programming (e.g. Golang or Java) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash, JavaScript or similar languages) is desired - Successful past internships at enterprise software companies are a plus - Prior compliance, security policy and procedures experience is a plus

Headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, TIBCO Software enables businesses to reach new heights on their path to digital distinction and innovation. From systems to devices and people, we interconnect everything, capture data in real time wherever it is, and augment the intelligence of organizations through analytical insights. Thousands of customers around the globe rely on us to build compelling experiences, energize operations, and propel innovation. Our teams flourish on new ideas and welcome individuals who thrive in transforming challenges into opportunities. From designing and building amazing products to providing excellent service; we encourage and are shaped by bold thinkers, problem-solvers, and self-starters. We are always adapting and providing exciting opportunities for our employees to grow, learn and excel. We value the customers and employees that define who we are; dynamic individuals willing to take the risks necessary to make big ideas come to life and who are comfortable collaborating in our creative, optimistic environment. TIBCO – we are just scratching the surface. **Overview** TIBCO Spotfire Analytics and Data Discovery Platform We are looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineering intern to join our analytics and data discovery platform, TIBCO Spotfire, and seize a unique opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing groups in TIBCO responsible for creating products driven by advanced computational and visual analytics. TIBCO Spotfire is used for analyzing different types of data by our customers from drug research to energy production patterns and sales figures. The Spotfire Engineering Infrastructure team focuses on the design and implementation of scripts and frameworks used to build, deploy, and maintain our products both internally and in Cloud environments. More Information about the company and products can be found at our website: https://www.tibco.com/products/tibco-spotfire **What You'll Do** The internship is designed to equip you with the skills, knowledge, and experience to accelerate your career development through intensive training, practical project work, and access to experienced mentors. You will gain real-world experience deploying our technology and receive regular peer and manager feedback opportunities As a member and intern of the Spotfire Engineering Infrastructure team you will: - Contribute improvements that add meaningful value to the TIBCO Cloud Spotfire deployment infrastructure through design and implementation of self-directed projects with support and mentorship from the team - Proactively solve problems with the help of other members of the team; some that are spread out geographically - Grow your real-world experience with Cloud providers such as AWS and Azure; and deployment orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes and Helm **Who You Are** - Pursuing a BS or a MS in Computer Science or related major - Ability to ramp up quickly and apply new technologies and processes - Working knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems - Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Windows PowerShell, Unix Shell - Experience with or exposure to deployment, configuration management and monitoring tools on the Cloud, particularly on AWS (ex. Container Management, Logging) - Exceptional motivation, enthusiasm and an aptitude to learn and contribute - Attention to detail and a passion for software quality - Excellent analytical, problem solving, reporting and communication skills - Self-directed with strong time management and organization skills **Additional Desirable Skills** - Familiarity with containerization and Cloud deployment tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Helm) - Experience with continuous deployment and integration tools (e.g. Jenkins, TeamCity)

position: Intern - Analyst - Summer 2022- CO or Nationwide
description: ABOUT LUMEN Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. THE ROLE Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As an Analyst intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Network Implementation Analytics Team to support metrics and reporting, dashboard creation, database scripting, etc. for the Network Implementation space. Tasks during the 10 weeks may include gathering analytics for network implementation and reporting from different systems like excel or PowerBI. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include: -    Data Analysis- bringing data from all over the company, cleansing data, and then reporting on data  -    Creating PowerBI dashboards -    Refreshing, evolving, and enhancing old dashboards -    Creating and enhancing existing PowerApps  -    Consolidating data for executive readouts -    Automating manual reporting WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior or masters level status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, MIS, or a related field. -    Proficiency and understanding of:  -    Microsoft Suites  -    Well versed in PowerBI and SQL -    Oracle Data Marts is a plus -    PowerApps is a plus -    Python is a plus -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results/solutions and taking initiative to resolve problems -    Comfortable approaching teammates and leadership -    High attention to detail -    Ability to communicate extremely well is necessary -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Self-starter with a positive attitude -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield, CO, Littleton, CO or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. About Futureforce University Recruiting Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more. Job Category Intern Job Details MuleSoft's Professional Services team works across every technology to deliver solutions to customers in every industry. As a Delivery Manager (DM) intern on our Services team, you will play an important role in our Services practice growth. MuleSoft is the leader in implementing the application network by connecting data, devices and applications, and we are pursuing people passionate about integration that enables digital transformation. The Delivery Manager interns will manage various internal project tasks and client project tasks under the guidance of an experienced MuleSoft DM. The purposes of the role are for the intern to gain experience, contribute to assigned projects and gain insights into interest in joining the Mulesoft Services team upon graduation. Below are some of the responsibilities that you will carry out in your role as DM Intern: Support MuleSoft DMs on multiple customer projects simultaneously Work closely with Delivery Manager(s) as part of the project team and provide assistance with project team/tasks management and execution Assist in the planning and management of project task executions and communicate status to all stakeholders Assist in the management of MuleSoft issues and risks, tracking and resolution Develop processes, templates, or tools as part of an internal continuous improvement team. What You'll Achieve Gain an understanding of digital transformation and professional services consulting. Real-life, hands on experience with delivering mission critical client projects impacting business and operations. Learn and experience core project management disciplines including the agile framework, risk and issue management, scheduling, tracking, budget management, and more. Complete Mulesoft training including our Mulesoft products, Catalyst methodologies for Services implementations and services offerings. Learn our Services' team internal processes for staffing and resourcing, partner engagement, and the entire lifecycle for managing Mulesoft projects. Complete training to understand the role of each Mulesoft team included in Services engagements - Customer Success, Engagement Management and Account Team. Learn the Catalyst and Center for Enablement methodology for implementing organizational change management jointly with our clients. Contribute to one or more internal projects and/or client-facing engagements Opportunities will be provided for voluntary time off (VTO) for giving back to the community. Learn and experience the unique Salesforce Ohana culture. What You'll Need to be Successful A rising senior (current junior) pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a preferred concentration in Computer Science, Management Information Systems (MIS), Information Systems, Business, or Marketing. Be able work independently and under management's direction Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment Aptitude for an operational and/or technical services role Demonstrate basic knowledge with waterfall and agile methodologies Demonstrate interest in career expansion as a project manager and/or scrum master Ability to work in collaboration with a client project manager or scrum master to lead the implementation through an entire software development lifecycle. Dynamic leadership aptitude Strong Verbal and written communication skills About MuleSoft, a Salesforce company Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world's applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald's, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we're committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form (https://careers.mail.salesforce.com/accommodations-request-form) . Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com (http://salesfore.com/) or Salesforce.org . Salesforce welcomes all. Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world. Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being ranked by Fortune as one of the Most Admired Companies in the World and one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For eleven years in a row, and named Innovator of the Decade and one of the World's Most Innovative Companies eight years in a row by Forbes. There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest. And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that's so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company. We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.

We are currently offering a Statistics/ Finance Internship

We are performing research on aspects related to investment risk.

This internship is right for a Masters or PhD student in Statistics, Finance, or Computer Science.

Project requires strong modeling skills or experience with Python and other languages and software.

This internship takes place remotely with most of the interactions taking place electronically and with almost daily conference calls. This is a virtual internship and a substantial time commitment is required.

Intern, Data Engineer The Job Details are as follows: Overview: We are looking for creative and enthusiastic Data Engineers to join our team in building the best Data Platform on the street. Were responsible for managing the flow of data into the firm, maintaining the data lake, creating analytics-ready datasets, and building the APIs that make everything accessible to our clients. Our singular goal is to help our investment teams use data to make better investment decisions. Our analysts and systematic trading teams rely on us to provide analytics-ready datasets. For each dataset we must consider the implications of point in time storage, optimize for our users access patterns, and create useful aggregations/slices. Our ideal candidate will have experience with storing, transforming, and modeling big data. In this role, you will be exposed to: * Developing cloud-first data ingestion processes using Python, SQL, and Spark * Engineering data models and infrastructure for a wide variety of market and alternative datasets * Designing and building services and plugins to enhance our Data Platform * Maintaining alerting systems to ensure smooth day-to-day operations for hundreds of datasets * Authoring tests to validate data quality and the stability of the platform * Investigating and defusing time-sensitive data incidents * Communicating with data providers to onboard new datasets and troubleshoot technical issues * Evangelizing best practices to our partners throughout the firm What Youll Bring: * A love of data and a passion for engineering * A thousand questions and a drive to exceed expectations * Candidacy for Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field * Strong analytical, data, and programming skills (Python/SQL/NoSQL) * Strong oral and written communication skills, most importantly, must be a team player

At NRC Health, we promise to help our customers bring human understanding to healthcare for their patients and communities. Our associates are at the heart of delivering that promise, so we promise that same human understanding to each other. Come where culture is everything. As an associate, you: Innovate with us to move healthcare forward. Give back to the community with volunteer time off. Fit your role and do what you love. Grow and develop along a career path designed by you. Support one another - no one says, That's not my job. Play hard at beer:30 and team outings - we have a lot to celebrate. Let life happen with 4+ weeks' time off, a flexible work environment, and dress for your day attire. Live healthy with a comprehensive healthcare plan and wellness program. Who we want Do you crave an opportunity to build your talents and make a difference? Are you a highly motivated and driven individual looking to kick start your professional career? Do you have a passion to make an impact in a mission-oriented industry? Are you an excellent communicator with strong business writing skills? Are you excited about developing new products or expanding the footprint of already-proven solutions in healthcare technology landscape? Do you relish the opportunity to partner with product teams under a one-team, one-dream model? Are you passionate about designing and delivering solutions to end-users? What you will do As an Engineering Intern, you will be immersed into NRC Health and our Engineering team. You will work with senior team members and take part in day-to-day activities across one or more of our solutions . As part of an agile team, you will partner with engineering leads, engineers, and QA to ensure we have development-ready specifications and doing the backlog prioritization. You will become a domain expert in the application/module you are supporting and work with engineering team to ensure predictable and high-quality product releases. Additionally, to enhance your overall understanding of NRC Health, we will provide opportunities to network with peers and leaders to gain an appreciation for the breadth of career paths available at NRC Health. What you need Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or similar majors Experience working across the full stack, SQL included Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Have Purpose. Think Boldly. Feel Connected. Be Understood.

Every day, Pendo's flagship analytics platform processes over 10.5 billion events and creates over 225,000 data analytics results. Every hour we ingest over 100+ million web and mobile events. Then in a fraction of a second we query hundreds of terabytes (or more) of data in order to respond to our users' actionsallowing users to discover valuable insights about their products. Pendo is looking for a dynamic, motivated, and self-driven individual to join our Information Security team this summer as a Security Engineer Intern! Are you passionate about cybersecurity and helping to protect complex cloud-based applications that serve millions of users? If this interests you, this role is for you! We are looking for a Computer Science major (or other technical discipline) interested in working in a fast-paced, rapidly growing tech environment with a complex SaaS application that faces millions of people. In addition to the day-to-day responsibilities this intern will hold, you'll also be provided mentorship and development via one-on-one time with our Chief Information Security Officer and other members of our Information Security team. Responsibilities (what you'll do): Participate as a member of the Information Security team on assigned operational and project-based tasks. Work will be varied and may include the following types of activities: Running and analyzing the results from vulnerability scans Developing scripts to help automate security tasks Reviewing and updating documentation for security policies and procedures Assessing risks and making recommendations for addressing them Educating Pendo staff on security threats, policies, and procedures Assisting with developing threat models for new services and product features Assisting with identifying and responding to potential cyber attacks Qualifications (what you have): Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline. Demonstrated experience, either through coursework, previous work, or self-study, in one or more of the following areas: Scripting and coding to automate systems and security administration tasks (e.g. using a language such as Python) Identifying, assessing, and remediating security vulnerabilities in web applications Securing cloud computing services (SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS) Evaluating risks associated with using third party services Creating and delivering security awareness training Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong critical thinking and time management capabilities. A passion for learning and a customer-focused mindset. Pendo Description: Pendo was founded in 2013 by former product managers, who combined their heads and hearts to build something they wanted but never had as product managers -- a simple way to understand and attack what truly drives product success. Our mission is to improve society's experience with software. Come join one of the fastest-growing startups, supported by best-in-class institutions like Battery Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, Spark Capital and Meritech. You will gain experience in a diverse and exciting set of technologies and clients and have a real impact on Pendo's future. Our culture is passionate, dynamic, and fun. EEOC We are an equal opportunity employer and believe having diverse teams where everyone brings their whole self to Pendo is key to our success. We welcome all people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Accessibility Pendo is committed to working with, and providing access and reasonable accommodation to, applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you think you may require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, please send a request to: accommodation@pendo.io. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.

Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. The Experience  -    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  -    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects -    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. -    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Analyst intern in our North American Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Field and Field Business Operations Team to support end-to-end Portfolio Management including data analytics and reporting. This position will work with data relevant to cost transformation portfolios, capital and revenue projects, as well as helping craft strategies to move field operations into the future. Tasks during the 10 weeks may require you to transform data into information that can be utilized to make business decisions and actions.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include: -    Acquiring data from multiple sources  -    Creating analytics to define and drive new opportunities  -    Correcting any reporting and/or data issues  -    Ensuring that databases remain error-free and organized -    Spot trends and anomalies within statistical data, to include using reporting and statistics tools  -    Work with various software packages, from reporting tools to statistical applications -    Strong job candidates will need to be able to quickly pick up new computer programs and use them efficiently    WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university- rising senior status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -    Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Data Science, Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, or a related field  -    Proficiency and understanding of: -    Microsoft Suites  -    Statistical and analytical tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Excel, Access, SQL)  -    Reporting and publishing tools (e.g., Microsoft Power Point, Visio, SharePoint, Teams)  -    Programming tools (e.g., XML, JavaScript, ETL frameworks) -    Computer skills -    Six Sigma is a plus -    Professional Attributes  -    Strong drive for results and taking initiative to resolve problems -    High attention to detail with STRONG organizational skills -    Time management skills -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation -    Comfortable communicating with stake holders   -    Ability to be resourceful and adaptable- independently AND in a team environment  -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  -    Analytical thinking – spot trends and anomalies within statistical data, to include using reporting and statistics tools -    Mathematics skills – good understanding of basic accounting/financial practices, statistical analysis techniques, capacity planning strategies, forecasting algorithms, and other similar math skills -    Flexible and adapts well to change -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield, CO, Frisco, TX, Monroe, LA, or Remote/Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) -    US work authorization  WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! Information Technology Internship (IT Intern 2)- 4148Honolulu,Hawaii,United States. Job Description HII-Technical Solutions is currently seeking an IT Intern to work out of our Honolulu, HI office. Huntington Ingalls Industries is seeking an Undergraduate Sophomore or Upcoming Sophomore to take part in our growing internship program. We are looking for a future IT professional, interested in breaking into the defense industry. As one of our interns, HII-TSD will offer you the opportunity to work alongside subject matter experts and assist in providing critical support to our clients. Our experts will provide on-the-job training, and ensure interns complete our program with the confidence to accurately apply and perform the skills learned in this internship throughout their future careers. This internship not only provides you the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a professional environment, but also allows you a look at what HII-TSD can offer you as an employee. Internships are offered in 90 day increments. Students may be invited to remain in the internship program for a nother 90 days, following an evaluation after the term. Essential Job Responsibilities * Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data center management * Assist with troubleshooting issues and provide technical support * Perform on-site installation/ configuration/ repair/ recovery/ back-up and preventative maintenance on PCs and related peripherals * Assist IT personnel in ensuring that hardware and software systems are fully deployed, implemented, and functioning Minimum Qualifications * Pursuing degree in the field of computer science, information sciences, or a related field * Ability to obtain/ maintain a security clearance * Moderate understanding of general job aspects and some understanding of the detailed aspects of the job * High School Diploma or equivalent plus must be working towards a Bachelor's degree with between 20% and 40% of the required credits completed. Preferred Requirements * Active Clearance: TS/SCI * Valid CompTIA Security + certification Physical Requirements Job performance will normally require only minor lifting and carrying of boxes of records or equipment. Building on a legacy of more than a century of naval shipbuilding, Technical Solutions, a division of Huntington Ingalls Industries provides mission-critical solutions to a wide variety of government and commercial customers worldwide. Comprising nearly 6,000 professionals in 45 states and 16 countries, our unique national security services portfolio includes unmanned systems, defense and federal solutions, and nuclear and environmental services. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com. Huntington Ingalls Industries is America's largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII's Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII's Technical Solutions division supports national security missions around the globe with unmanned systems, nuclear and environmental services, and defense and federal solutions. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than 42,000 people operating both domestically and internationally. For more information, visit: www.huntingtoningalls.com . Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.HII Technical Solutions

   Look up information in our internal databases to provide a timely and accurate response to law enforcement agencies -    Become familiar with DMCA, CALEA, and cybersecurity basics to help protect Lumen from compliance concerns and brand erosion by following daily procedures to respond to the hundreds of daily cases/tickets we receive   WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE -    Education Requirements  -    Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating preferably August 2022 – May 2023. -    Basic IP Address and computer networking skills needed  -    Familiarity with privacy law and cybersecurity principals  -    Any IT related or paralegal/criminal justice type of education would be helpful  -    Professional Attributes -    Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Ability to speak up in meetings to voice thoughts and opinions  -    Posses a selfless attitude and always be a team player- team first mentality  -    Open and honest communicator -    Attention to detail with strong organizational skills -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Strong written and verbal communication skills -    Comfortability in group settings with giving presentations  -    Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation. -    Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Monroe, LA or Remote- Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations) WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview.
